main event: A horseshoe-shaped object about one-third the diameter of the moon was observed for 1 1/3 seconds. It was bright orange, appeared to be dark in the center, and was pulsating. A bright flash on the horizon was also observed, and after that, a similar object appeared below the horizon for a short while before fading out.
interesting points: The object appeared to have wing-like features that seemed to be rotating.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of 13,000 to 15,000 feet.
The observation period was around 30 minutes, and the object passed out of sight and was lost below the horizon.
No trail or smoke was observed, and no sound was heard.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with a slight cirrus undercast.
sighted object: Horseshoe-shaped, bright orange object with pulsating light
witnesses: Co-pilot Colonel Holly Anderson and pilot Major A. E. Gasperson of a KC-135 aircraft
